page.title: 06THE CHURCH _THE PAST
page.content:
The stone church of St.Nicholas stands on the hill at High Bradfield, protected from the cold winds by higher ground rising behind it.It was built in 1480 on the site of an earlier church built by the monks of Ecclesfield.The earliest stained glass window,dating from the 13th century & therefore probably a relic of the earlier church,shows the founding of the church by the Prior of Ecclesfield The stone slab of the oldest grave of Ellen Wilson who died in 1598,now forms part of the floor of the central aisle.The ancient documents of the church are kept in the City Archives, but one letter dated 2nd June 1743 & written to the Archbishop of York,is retained by the church.
.
